prevention: Be extremely cautious of investment advice from Nextdoor or neighborhood app contacts
Never move financial conversations to private messaging apps (WhatsApp, Telegram)
Research any trading platform through official regulatory databases
Be skeptical of mentors offering to trade alongside you
Understand that Bitcoin has limited smart contract capability (terminology red flag)
Never pay fees to withdraw your own funds from trading platforms
Test withdrawals with small amounts before large investments
Recognize cost-splitting offers as manipulation tactic
Verify extraordinary profits through independent blockchain analysis
Consult financial advisors before large cryptocurrency investments
detection: Community app contact suggesting investment opportunities (major red flag)
Platform migration from public to private messaging
Verification fees or percentage fees to access your own money
Account balance inflation between fee demands
Mentor offering to pay portions of your fees
Multiple escalating fee demands with different justifications
Technical explanations that don't match blockchain reality
Profits that seem too good to be true (300k → 4.5M)
Lack of regulatory licensing or oversight
response: Stop all payments immediately - demands will never end
Do NOT pay third fee demand or any subsequent demands
Report to FBI IC3, FTC, FinCEN, state regulators immediately
Document all Nextdoor, WhatsApp conversations with Erika
Preserve blockchain transaction records and platform screenshots
Report Erika's Nextdoor and WhatsApp accounts
Warn Nextdoor community about the scam pattern
Alert neighborhood about crypto investment solicitations
Consult attorney about recovery options (but beware recovery scams)
Seek financial counseling to recover from losses
Share experience with crypto safety communities to warn others
